Class GameOfLife

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameOfLife
  • public class GameOfLife
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Rand Hasan, Period 11 11/5/2019 GameOfLife.java Ch7 Arrays, Game of Life Assignment This is a program of the Game of Life which models a simple world consisting of a 2D plane of cells. User begins game by choosing coordinates for live cells for the 1st day. As the days go on, the creatures are born or die according to the number of neighboring creatures from the previous day.

      GameOfLife()  

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static int[][] createNewDay​(int[][] matrix)
      Loops through the array, matrix, and applies rules to each cell to determine in they will be alive or dead on the following day
      static int findNumNeighbors​(int[][] matrix, int row, int col)
      Calculates the number of cells that store the number one and adjoin the cell in the row and column that were called either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally
      static int getCoordinate​(char type)
      Makes sure that the user enters integers (and not any other data type) for the coordinates of the cell that are within the range of the matrix or are the flag variable
      static boolean isValidCell​(int row, int col, int[][] matrix)
      Checks to see if a cell can be placed into the desired row and column inputed by the user
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)  
      static void printData​(int[][] matrix)
      Loops through the elements in the array called matrix and prints an X if they store a one and 0 if they store a zero

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

      • isValidCell

        public static boolean isValidCell​(int row,
                                  int col,
                                  int[][] matrix)
        Checks to see if a cell can be placed into the desired row and column inputed by the user
        Parameters:
        row - the row that the user wishes to place a cell in
        col - the column that the user wishes to place a cell in
        matrix - the array that stores cells and will hold the cells the user wishes to place in the desired row and column
        Returns:
        true if the cell is within the bounds of the matrix

      • getCoordinate

        public static int getCoordinate​(char type)
        Makes sure that the user enters integers (and not any other data type) for the coordinates of the cell that are within the range of the matrix or are the flag variable
        Parameters:
        type - determines if the user is entering the row or the column that a cell is in
        Returns:
        the coordinate for the row or column if it is an integer in the range of the matrix or the flag variable

      • printData

        public static void printData​(int[][] matrix)
        Loops through the elements in the array called matrix and prints an X if they store a one and 0 if they store a zero
        Parameters:
        matrix - the array that is looped through to print out columnar data

      • createNewDay

        public static int[][] createNewDay​(int[][] matrix)
        Loops through the array, matrix, and applies rules to each cell to determine in they will be alive or dead on the following day
        Parameters:
        matrix - the array that is looped through in order to apply the rules to each cell to create the array for the next day
        Returns:
        the array holding cells for the following day

      • findNumNeighbors

        public static int findNumNeighbors​(int[][] matrix,
                                   int row,
                                   int col)
        Calculates the number of cells that store the number one and adjoin the cell in the row and column that were called either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally
        Parameters:
        matrix - the array that stores all of the cells in the game
        row - the row of the cell in the matrix whose number of neighbors is being calculated
        col - the column of the cell in the matrix whose number of neighbors is being calculated
        Returns:
        the number of cells that store the number one and are neighboring the cell in the row and column that were called
